description: The 'generate_single_line_plot' function creates a single line plot visualization based on the provided data points. It is designed for educational purposes, allowing students to visualize and understand the relationship between different data points in a dataset. The function also includes various customization options such as title and axis labels, providing a flexible tool for educators to create meaningful visualizations.

stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'generate_single_line_plot' function is capable of creating single line plot visualizations. It accepts a SingleLinePlot object as input, which contains information about the data points to be plotted, the title of the plot, and labels for the x-axis. The function is designed with flexibility in mind, allowing for a wide range of data types and scales. It also includes validation rules to ensure the input data is suitable for a line plot. The function is ideal for visualizing and teaching concepts related to data analysis, trends, and correlations.

details: The function accepts a SingleLinePlot object as input. This object contains the following fields: 'data_points', 'title', and 'x_axis_label'.

The 'data_points' field is a list of DataPoint objects, each of which represents a point on the line plot. Each DataPoint object contains a 'value' field (the x-coordinate of the point), a 'frequency' field (the y-coordinate of the point), a 'value_parsed' field (a parsed version of the 'value' field), and a 'value_label' field (a label for the x-coordinate).
The 'title' field is a string that specifies the title of the plot.
The 'x_axis_label' field is a string that specifies the label for the x-axis.
The 'data_points' field must contain at least one DataPoint object.
The 'value' and 'frequency' fields of each DataPoint object must be numbers.
The 'value_parsed' field of each DataPoint object must be a number and is calculated based on the 'value' field.
The 'value_label' field of each DataPoint object is optional and defaults to the string representation of the 'value' field if not provided.
The function generates a single line plot with the specified data points.
The plot includes a title and an x-axis label, both of which can be customized.
The y-axis is not labeled and the plot includes a horizontal line at y=0.
The function calculates the size of the plot based on the number and values of the data points, ensuring that all data points are visible and appropriately spaced.
